verses.roman:
'maṇeka candana, tolā-viśeka karpūra
gopāle parāiba'--ei ānanda pracura

synonyms: maṇeka candana—one māna of sandalwood; tolā—a measurement of weight; viśeka—twenty; karpūra—camphor; gopāle—on Gopāla; parāiba—I shall smear; ei—this; ānanda—pleasure; pracura—sufficient.
translation: "Without considering his personal comforts, Mādhavendra Purī carried one māna [about eighty-two pounds] of sandalwood and twenty tolās [about eight ounces] of camphor to smear over the body of Gopāla. This transcendental pleasure was sufficient for him.
